name: Iberostar Varadero

reviews.text: Iberostar is one of the reasons people keep returning to Cuba:
reviews.title: Great Value and Good Resort

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Friendly people always willing to help, lots of activities and resort staff eager to get visitors and their kids involved, sunshine, heat and beaches.
reviews.title: August @ Iberostar Varadero

reviews.text: It is expensive for Canadians to travel to Europe, just like it is expensive for Europeans and Brits to travel to Cuba. Regardless, when the service warrants a tip; it should be given no matter where one goes. The Cubans are happy for any tip unlike some of their counterparts in other parts of the world who give poor service and still expect to be tipped. A peso or two are not going to break the bank, when the drinks are all inclusive.
reviews.title: Fantastic good value for money

reviews.text: The food is very good and a lot of variety. So many deserts, so little time. I cannot understand how people who normally eat cornflakes for breakfeast and egg and chips for dinner have any reasons to complain.
reviews.title: Honest and True Review as per Baldy Mans

reviews.text: The pools were clean and warm and included lots of areas for shade. There were activities around the pool all day to suit all ages.
reviews.title: Attention to detail

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Pros -
reviews.title: Great place to unwind

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Good location, right on the beach
reviews.title: iberostar varadero over ranked imo

reviews.text: Fantastic breakfast and evening buffet..loads of choice..something for everyone..we even had rabbit one night!
reviews.title: Fabulous Family Vacation

reviews.text: Brilliant poolside restaurant with lots of lovely salads, prawns, cold meats, freshly made pizzas, gorgeous rotisserie chicken
reviews.title: Lovely hotel!

reviews.text: Very convenient beach bar and grill with nice burgers
reviews.title: must stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: As with all of our trips we researched our destination using Tripadvisor (our favorite) and the advice of friends and family. Based on this we expected Cuba to be good but not amazing due to food quality. The Tripadvisor reports sounded good for this resort but many friends and aquaintances reported the "Food in Cuba is not good". We we pleasantly surprised! The food at this resort was very good! We have enjoyed staying at other Iberostar resorts (Grand Paraiso and Grand Bavaro) and found the food here in Cuba to be very good even compared to these upscale resorts that we enjoyed previously.
reviews.title: Pleasantly Surprised!

reviews.text: This trip we were meeting our daughter and her husband and our grand-daughter who live in another province. Typically we try to stay in adult resorts so were unsure of this change in choice. Again we were pleased. The resort had chlidren present but they did not run the place. It was a great balance. If you plan to travel with children I think they would be entertained but you would not feel like you are at a daycare (maybe unless at school breaks?) Our grand-daughter (2 years old) loved the children's evening program. We did not stay for all the evening entertainment. Would have enjoyed more opportunities to dance to Cuban type music instead of just the "thumping music" in the disco (which we did enjoy a little ;) but just not all night long every night. Perhaps they could have dancing in theatre area more. We did see some talented people including the sax player and a young man dressed all in white (can't remember their names).
reviews.title: This hotel just keeps getting better!

reviews.text: We could always find a place to enjoy the pool or beach. The staff were mostly excellent. The resort had the feel of the Carribean with it's lovely bright decor. Nice and clean and well run. We like resorts that are not too big. Everything was within reasonable walking distance. We did not hesitate to go back to our room if we needed to as it was always close. We did not worry about our stuff at the chairs while we enjoyed the pool or the ocean.
reviews.title: Mostly good, a few disappointments.

reviews.text: We felt very safe in Cuba and hope to return soon. Love the people and the music!!
reviews.title: amazing stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: At no time did we feel pressured to tip. All staff were amazing except a couple of pool bar staff who were not as friendly as the majority of the other staff. The gentleman who assisted us on the catamaran and the dance instructor by the pool were both excellent (both name Uni or Juni not sure of spelling :)
reviews.title: Fantastic!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: After much consideration and reading a lot of reviews I chose the Iberostar Varadero for a 2 week break for myself and my boyfriend - the hotel definitely exceeded my expectations.
reviews.title: Brilliant, no complaints

reviews.text: Food
reviews.title: Families with young kids, chose this hotel

reviews.text: I am a fussy eater and this was a big consideration when choosing a hotel. At the Iberostar i found that there was never a shortage of food that i enjoyed. The buffet did lack in variety a little bit and after 2 weeks we were ready for something different, but i think that would be the same in any hotel. I found the cleanliness in the main buffet to be very good. You should definitely try the custom made omlette in the morning - they make it in front of you and you get a range of fillings to choose from. They also make pasta to order although we did not try this. Whilst eating we found that our glass was always kept topped up with wine, no matter how busy the restaurant was! For lunch there was a choice of the buffet by the pool, which was good although quite small and pretty much the same every day, or the beach bbq which was lovely!
reviews.title: loved our wedding here

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: As for the A La Carte restaurants, we were not too keen on the Mediterranean as it was a very fish based menu and neither of us each much fish. Thankfully, in our second week we were able to swap this for another restaurant. We really enjoyed the Japanese because it also provided entertainment and had a fantastic fried banana dessert! But our favorite was the international restaurant, which served a good mix of food and had a lovely pancake dessert.
reviews.title: Great Value for $$$!!

reviews.text: Overall, we were impressed with the food and never went hungry.
reviews.title: excellent room, excellent food and good hotel facilities.

reviews.text: We stayed here in may for 2 weeks and this hotel is ranked number 1 because it is totally worthy. We stayed in Iberostar Tainos 4 years ago and that was good, but this is miles better. If you are planning a holiday its worth that little extra to stay here. The rooms are nice, spacious, comfortable with coffee machine, ice bucket, mini fridge with beer and soft drinks, bathrobe and slippers and complimentary room service. The grounds are well maintained , the gardeners give you little handmade presents made from palm leaves and it is right on the beach. The pool has two sections, one which can be used for a swim. There is a pool bar and the pina coladas are worth a try. The bar staff work hard and you get drinks brought to your lounger. There is ALWAYS spare loungers no matter what time of day and it doesn't feel busy or cramped. The beach is nice . If you like snorkelling then its worth taking a catamaran from the hotel water sports centre, it is a little extra but they will take you out to the best spot for snorkelling, remember to take some full bananas including skins the fish will eat the lot, don't forget the underwater camera its totally amazing.
reviews.title: Amazing Hotel 5 star without question

reviews.text: The bar service is excellent and drink quality is good, the cocktails were nice and service to the table. The meals in the a la carte and the main restaurant were excellent, loads of choice, plenty of fresh fruit, salad, fish and cooked meats. There was paella cooked by the poolside once and also one evening they had fresh crab, mussels, scallops, cockles and lobster. The restaurant staff couldn't do enough, thank you Yaiquelin you really made our holiday special.
reviews.title: Great hotel for relaxing week

reviews.text: The entertainment team were very good I really enjoyed the archery with Alberto VO5. There were plenty of activities to participate in its just up to you how much or little you want to do.
reviews.title: Best Varadero Has to Offer

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: There is plenty of mosquitos so make sure you bring plenty of repellent even though they fumigate the area with a plane regularly.
reviews.title: Very friendly Hotel in Varadero

reviews.text: The kids club was amazing, the staff went above and beyond the even took the kids for lunch and dinner if they wanted. They worked really hard and were full of energy. They did games with the kids, picnics, parties, piñata and a small waterpark. The children totally enjoyed all the time with them thank you anna, llianlei and the rest of the team
reviews.title: Excellent weekend!

reviews.text: We stayed at the Iberostar Vardero from Oct 19th ~ Oct 26th travelled with 23 of our loved ones to celebrate our Wedding on (Oct 23rd). The drive from the Airport to Iberostar wasn't too long about 35minutes. We had a wonderful guide (Mauricio) very informative of what to expect at the resort, very friendly, the ride didn't feel long at all. Bonus for us- we had a private bus because of the size of our group :)
reviews.title: Wedding Review/Family Trip

reviews.text: When we arrived at Iberostar, there were tropical beverages served to all of us while we waited in line to check in. Check in was fast, and the gentleman delivered the luggage to our rooms within minutes. We were fortunate to have stayed in Block 17 Jr Suite. The room was huge and so clean. There was a note greeting us with a plate full of Fresh Fruit and Champagne. Air conditioning worked great, we had it on the whole time given how hot and humid it was the first few days.
reviews.title: Nice Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This resort isn't too big so it's very easy to walk around and so much activities to do. We absolutely loved the childrens water park as we found the water to be a bit cooler (on the hottest day it was a blessing) We took our son there everyday and he had a blast. The Tipping bucket was a huge bonus, soo refreshing. The Beach is truly beautiful, water so clear and warm, the sand is so soft felt like powder beneath your feet. The buffet has soo much variety we enjoyed everything that was offered. My son can sometimes be a picky eater but ate so much without any complaints. We especially enjoyed the Burgers for lunch by the Beach Bar and Grill.
reviews.title: Absolutely fabulous

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: For the Wedding, we met with the Coordinator Belkis who truly knows how to put a Wedding together. We met with her on the Monday and picked out the location,flowers, all the fine details to personalize the day for us. We brought some of our own music to Walk down to and they accomodated every request we had. The day of the Wedding was hot but we enjoyed every bit of that sunshine.
reviews.title: Most organized bit of Cuba I've been so far :)

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The ceremony was quick & the view just breathtaking. All our guests were seated and we were all served champagne after the ceremony. After dancing on the beach, and taking pictures with the photographer we all had dinner at La Parilla which was decorated so nicely for us. The Wedding meal was amazing and the portions were soo big we felt bad we couldn't finish it all. We then went to the Beach Gazebo for our Private Beach party. You have to pay for this, but it is worth every penney! We had our own bartender and DJ who played some great tunes while incorporating some of our music we brought. Everyone enjoyed that party and the Cake was so delicious (Vanilla) I wish I had the room to have eaten more of it.
reviews.title: Great holiday

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This was our second trip to this resort. We travelled from Nov 10 to 17th this year and about the same time last year. This is still an excellent resort in Cuba and worthy of its high rating, although there were a couple of problems which were already mentioned in other recent reviews. We have been to many other hotels in Cuba as well many other places in the Caribbean and you don't get much better value for the money for Canadians at least.
reviews.title: Great Trip to Iberostar Varadero

reviews.text: Here are the Pros and Cons as we saw them:
reviews.title: Not What I Expected...

reviews.text: Pro's:
reviews.title: Great Vacation

reviews.text: 1. Fantastic Staff. Every staff member we encountered was pleasant and happy to help us. Our favorites waitress was again Yaqueline. She was awesome and restaurant service was excellent. Our chambermaid Niurka was also great. She made many beautiful pieces of towel art as well as hand-written thank-you notes for gifts we left. The people here in the Cuba are the best part of the island (along with the safe and clean beaches). Poolside and beachside drink service was an unexpected surprise!
reviews.title: Great vacation

reviews.text: 2. The Resort - We got a great room in Block 18 with a nice view of the center courtyard. Room was clean and large. Bathroom was large and no problem with water pressure or temperature. The grounds are very well kept as are most of the facilities. Groundskeepers were constantly working to keep things looking good. There is a really nice waterpark at the far end of the resort - did not seem to be used much but it looked great for kids.
reviews.title: Good Hotel, Fab for weddings

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: -No complains....nice hotel to stay at.
reviews.title: great hotel

reviews.text: -We stayed from Aug 30 to Sep 6....There is no longer the mosquito issue as previous reviews stated. I always get bitten alive & this was not the case.
reviews.title: Amazing Place, highly recommeded

reviews.text: -Buffet food is good.
reviews.title: The Best!

reviews.text: -We went to all three restuarants.. Perferred Mediterrean & Japanese...least liked Cuban...Book all reservations the day after you get there.
reviews.title: Amazing resort and the staff is fantastic

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: -Always good service...don't have to tip in order to get service. All friendly & all willing to serve...weather you tip or not.
reviews.title: Wonderful resort but wouldn't go back to Cuba...

reviews.text: From the staff on the reception desk to the staff who work in the kitchen the service is excellent. I have now stayed at this hotel four times and am returning in June this year. The staff are very friendly and nothing is ever a problem. Keep up the good work and I look forward as always to returning yet again.
reviews.title: Why I keep returning

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at the Varadero from 24th November to 9th December. We have stayed in several Iberostars in the Caribean and have always found them to be excellent. However in spite of the many favourable reviews I did not expect the same quality because Cuba is such a very poor country. So we were pleasantly surprised when the hotel exceeded our expectations.
reviews.title: iberostar varadero exceeded my expectations

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: On arrival we were allocated a first floor room quite some way from the main amenities. I explained that my husband has walking difficulties and we were given a ground floor room close to the pool, reception etc. The rooms were nicely decorated and cleaning was excellent.
reviews.title: Not perfect, but pretty darn good.

reviews.text: Food was perhaps not as varied as in other Iberostars but that is to be expected with the current embargo. Breakfast and evening meals were fine but we did find that the lunchtime buffet near the pool was often cold even immediately after serving had commenced.
reviews.title: An all inclusive resort where you don't have to worry about a thing

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The pools were lovely but much too cold for me and the beach was nothing special although we did stop at a beautiful beach on the way to Havana. There always seemed to be plenty of sunbeds even though the hotel was reportedly full.
reviews.title: Disappointed

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This hotel is both good and bad at the sanme time in quite didtinctive ways.
reviews.title: A hotel of 2 halves

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: First the ground are excellent. Lots of garden with ornamental ponds, good swimming pools and a nearby beach. I don't think anyone could grumble apart form the hike to the restaurant etc being 400 yards from stalag 16 where we stayed and then a hike up 6 flights of stairs (3 floors - no lift). That is a round trip of near half a mile and it is worse when it is bucketing down in a violent thunderstorm. Umbrellas were provided.
reviews.title: Beauty resort

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The bad part is the food. It is really quite bad. Breakfast was the worst of our stay. Why have sliced boiled carrots simmering in a tray of fat on a hot plate. These where next to the scrambled eggs that you could ingest with a straw. The bacon was just rind floating in fat and the sausage was frankfurter in warmish water. The toaster did not work ok (7 times round for warm bread). The waffles were spongy limp affairs with sweet sauces all handled by too many people until there was an almighty mess. One young boy tipped baked beans onto the friut when trying to serve himself. A lot of people handled the food and then put it back.. At one lunch I saw one chef handle raw chicken then without any hand cleansing at all went on to handle the cooked food.
reviews.title: PERFECTION

reviews.text: Just after reception the tangy odour of sewage was quite pervasive during our stay. The rooms where adequate but no more. One of the worst things was the constant shouting from the chamber maids. They yelled at full scream to thier mates on other floors and even other buildings all day long. When the supplies were delivered by the golf carts, yelling was the preffered means of communication.
reviews.title: Fab Hotel, Excellent Staff, Well Worth a Visit

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Tipping was a nightmare. Although none of the staff asked for a tip there was always the glass at the side for tips and during the course of a meal there where about 6 people in the running. Some people tipped the chef and the drinks server and the table clearers then the person on the door for good measure. Tips were offered to the barmen after every drink. Then the wanderining musicians were to be considered and the pianist and the fellow who stood as still as a statue by your table and the dancers who flew in and out and the magician and Charlie Chaplin. I could list many more. It would have been much better all round to put say £10 per person per day into a pot to be shared out.
reviews.title: lovely hotel if the weather is good

reviews.text: Just arrived home yesterday and already miss the place. can't say enough about the staff. so friendly and didn't expect tips. but tips were very much appreciated. the "Star Friends" staff go to know our names and were very pleased to see us; encouraging us to enjoy the many activities. You can chose just to sit and relax in the many quiet areas of the resort or join in on bingo, games & shows around the pool & beach. Its seem a great place to bring children as they always seemed to be doing something. The children even got to participate in a few nightly shows. the parents all thought the kids club was fantastic. If anyone complains about the food; then i'd have to say they are just way too picky. most people just eat corn flakes for breakfast at home, so why complain when you can have waffles, pancakes, eggs, bacon, meat, etc etc. our plane was late coming in so didn't arrive to the hotel until almost midnight. we were hungry so went to the buffet, and out from seemingly nowhere, a man arrived with a huge plate of hot french fries for us and threw on hamburgers. what a great welcome. one night at the japanese restaurant; our chef knew our son loved to cook and had him come up at cook at the grill for everyone. made his week. needless to say, the staff really go out of their way to make sure everyone is happy. our room was spotless & every day a new design from our towels, blankets etc. we brought bags full of goodies for the staff. gave a baseball glove to one man & i was told his son kept it by his pillow at night. they also loved the chocolates, vitamin c & cough syrup. dont forget the gardeners & pool cleaners too as they really do a great job of making the resort spotless & beautiful. We would definately come back & unless you are really picky this is the place for you; both young & old alike. strongly recommended for a good vacation whether it's for relaxation or for partying in cuba. didn't notice any mosquitos but in fact the cubans spray repellant twice a day. if possible try to go on the snorkelling trip on the catamarang in the ocean. ask the catamarang man to take you. a lot cheaper than going through an agent. Service always available for drinks and food for early birds or night owls.
reviews.title: a great place to stay

reviews.text: Well first i will say be careful about the water. At each meal the great staff will bring around water in a jug. Every other hotel we have stayed at will bring around bottled water and crack the seal infront of you. Here we had no idea where that water has come from. To make a long story short out of the 9 times we hhave been to Cuba this is the first time we have gotten really SICK!!!!!!! Food was below ok, very european lot of unreconizable food to us North Americans. Few times the tongs at the buffett fell on the ground and they were picked up and used again. We stayed here because we brought our kids. The previous times we stayeed at SANDALS and it is well under rated on this site. Lots of kids and a few parents that could care less about what they did eg. splashing others in the pool, yelling, Some parents seemed like they had given up on controling theri kids (french and english) oh boy. Rooms always nice/maid very nice. Bottom line if there is only adults on the trip stay at sandals (should be #1) but if your going with kids then find a really good deal or you wont get your money's worth.

This was to be our relaxing 5* beach hotel experience after a self-made family trip ( 2 adultys and 2 children aged 8 and 5) that took in Havana, Vinales, Bay of Pigs and Trinidad). We (the adults) were however disappointed.
reviews.title: Not the experience we were hoping for

reviews.text: The welcome was warm and friendly with a glass of bubbly and a buggy took us to our block. We had massive, clean and well-equipped inter-connecting rooms with a large balcony and TV. The food in the main restaurant was good quality and varied (though the themed restaurants were not worth the extra cost). The pools were warm and large, the kids enjoyed the free (laid back) club and the nightly children's disco. The calm turquoise sea was breathtakingly beautiful.
reviews.title: Fantastic Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The disappointment came with the number of people for the public areas around the pool and on the narrow strip of beach. It was difficult to find sunloungers, certainly not in the shade and highly unlikely unless you put a towel out at dawn. You were squashed up next to other people - not at all relaxing. The other shock was the amplified downmarket animation round the pool (Mr Tarzan or bingo) and disco on the beach. This happended twice a day. The evening shows ended (with the same tired old tracks) at 11pm and then the night club started but that was indoors and sound-proofed. It was a shame as they could have landscaped the gardens away from the pool to make quieter and shady areas.
reviews.title: Marvelous Hotel - Want to go Back....NOW !!!

reviews.text: Stayed here after a week on the road in Cuba and was totally shattered when I got here. Check in was fast, luggage arrived very quickly. Room was roomy even though 3 were sharing. Bathroom was large and had a separate dressing area which was very handy with 3 sharing!!!
reviews.title: I'm wondering how I can still walk

reviews.text: The pool was clean and well laid out with shallow and deep ends well marked. There's also a kiddy pool and playground separate but close to the main pool. There is a poolside bar with a lovely guy taking drinks around to the loungers, great if you can't be bothered to move lol.
reviews.title: Butlins in the Sun-not what you would expect from a 5* hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Food in Cuba will never be world class but to be honest, it was decent food and plenty of it. We managed 3 x 3 course meals daily without any difficulty. The cakes and fruit were lovely, especially the mangos. The salads often had meat in them, something our veggie friend had issue with, but she did manage to eat well all week without an omellette in sight. Wine was offered with each meal though coffee in the restaurant was not good. Go to reception after your meal and have a coffee there, much nicer.
reviews.title: lovely high end hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The bar in reception was lovely and airy, no air con but fans and the open plan design took care of that no problem.
reviews.title: Best decision ever

reviews.text: The animation team worked incredibly hard and put on a show each evening in the special show bar, The Chicago show was especially good. The dancing was prof quality, Look out for the synchronised swimming at the pool on a saturday afternoon. Beach and pool games are organised every day, I didn't have the energy to look let alone join in but people did seem to have fun. Also if you run out of reading matter, go to the towel exchange and you'll find a little library of books that they're happy for you to take foc. If you don't want to take your book home, do leave it for them to pass on, they'll appreciate it.
reviews.title: The Perfect Wedding, The Perfect Vacation

description: Directly on the beach of Varadero. Iberostar's first 5 star hotel in Cuba. Luxury and comfort in an elegant atmosphere. Top gastronomy and excellent service. Equipped for every kind of meeting, gala dinner, party, etc.. Ideal for groups & incentives.
